required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection (SCAD) and Autoimmunity
clinical_study.official_title: Determining the Association Between Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection (SCAD) and Autoimmunity

brief_summary.textblock: This case control study aims to determine whether spontaneous coronary artery dissection (SCAD) is associated with autoimmune diseases and to update the incidence of SCAD in a population-based cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: Odds of autoimmune disease in SCAD cases compared to controls
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, or approximately 50 years (average age of study participants)
Through study completion, or approximately 50 years (average age of study participants)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, or approximately 50 years (average age of study participants)

other_outcome.measure: Odds of laboratory markers for autoimmune disease in SCAD cases compared to controls
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, or approximately 50 years (average age of study participants)

other_outcome.measure: Odds of validated rheumatoid arthritis in SCAD cases compared to controls
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, or approximately 50 years (average age of study participants)
other_outcome.description: using the Rochester Epidemiology Project Rheumatoid Arthritis cohort

arm_group.description: SCAD cases will be identified based on presence of at least one diagnosis code for SCAD followed by manual verification by a trained individual, OR, inclusion in the previously validated SCAD cohort (Tweet 2012).
Potential controls will be identified based on absence of any SCAD diagnosis codes.

study_pop.textblock: The Rochester Epidemiology Project (REP) is a population-based cohort that includes medical record data for over 500,000 unique individuals who resided in Olmsted County at some point between 1966 and the present, and received health care for any reason within the system (St. Sauver 2012).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults age 18 to 110
- Residence in Olmsted County. Note: if sufficient numbers cannot be reached using only Olmsted County, will expand to the 27-county region.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

link.description: The "Virtual" Multicenter Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection (SCAD) Registry
Genetic Investigations in Spontaneous Coronary Artery Dissection (SCAD)
